content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Given a DataFrame df_cars with column `model`, write a function `count_model_rows` that groups data by model and calculate how many rows there are for each.

Here is an example using the DataFrames package in Julia:
```julia
using DataFrames, CategoricalArrays

function count_model_rows(df::DataFrame)
    grouped = groupby(df, :model)
    return nrow.(grouped)
end
```
This function takes a DataFrame as input and returns an array of integers representing the number of rows in each group.

Please note that this code assumes that your DataFrame has a column named "model". If it doesn't, you will need to adjust the code accordingly. Similarly, if your DataFrame is not sorted by model, the results might be misleading or incorrect because `groupby` groups consecutive rows with the same value in the specified column together.

If you want to count all rows regardless of model, you can use:
```julia
function count_all_rows(df::DataFrame)
    return nrow(df)
end
```
